title: Tender Grilled Short Ribs
full_text:
Tender Grilled Short Ribs
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
15 mins
Active
15 mins
Resting Time
5 mins
Total
30 mins
Serves
4 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
pounds
boneless short ribs
or
4
pounds
English-cut short ribs (see note)
Kosher salt
and freshly ground black pepper
Directions
If using boneless short ribs, cut into four 8-ounce portions, about 2 inches wide and 6 inches long apiece. If using English-cut short ribs, use a sharp knife to remove meat from bones. Save bones for another use.
Serious Eats / Melissa Hom
Light one chimney full of charcoal.
When all the charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and arrange the coals on one side of the charcoal grate. Set cooking grate in place, cover grill and allow to preheat for 5 minutes. Alternatively, set half the burners on a gas grill to the highest heat setting, cover, and preheat for 10 minutes.
Clean and oil
the grilling grate.
Serious Eats / Melissa Hom
Season short ribs liberally with salt and pepper and place directly over coals. Cook, turning frequently, until charred on all sides and probe thermometer inserted into thickest part of steak registers 125°F (54°C), 8 to 10 minutes total. Transfer to a cutting board, tent with foil, and let rest for 5 minutes.
Serious Eats / Melissa Hom
Thinly slice short ribs
against the grain
and serve immediately.
Serious Eats / Melissa Hom
Special Equipment
Charcoal grill
or
gas grill
,
chimney starter (optional)
Notes
English cut short ribs are short ribs that are cut with one long piece of bone in each one, about two and a half inches wide and six inches long. Look for ribs with plenty of meat and a good amount of marbling.
